verses.kjv: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,
verses.web: In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,
verses.ct: During that time, John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness of Judaea, preaching a message to everyone who would listen.

verses.kjv: And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
verses.web: “Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!”
verses.ct: "Repent," he declared, "because the kingdom of heaven is near!"

verses.kjv: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
verses.web: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, make the way of the Lord ready! Make his paths straight!”
verses.ct: John was the one the prophet Isaiah had spoken about when he wrote: "A voice cries out in the wilderness: 'Prepare the way for the Lord! Clear a straight path for him!'"

verses.kjv: And the same John had his raiment of camel’s hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.
verses.web: Now John himself wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.ct: John wore rough clothing made from camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist. He lived on locusts and wild honey.

verses.kjv: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,
verses.web: Then people from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him.
verses.ct: People poured out to see him — from Jerusalem, from all across Judaea, and from the entire region along the Jordan River.

verses.kjv: And were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.web: They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.ct: They confessed their sins, and he baptized them in the Jordan.

verses.kjv: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.web: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.ct: But when John saw large numbers of Pharisees and Sadducees showing up to be baptized, he confronted them: "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to run from the coming wrath?

verses.kjv: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
verses.web: Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance!
verses.ct: Prove your repentance by the way you live!

verses.kjv: And think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
verses.web: Don’t think to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father,’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
verses.ct: And don't comfort yourselves by saying, 'We're descendants of Abraham.' I'm telling you, God could turn these stones into children of Abraham.

verses.kjv: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.web: “Even now the ax lies at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire.
verses.ct: The axe is already at the root of the trees. Every tree that doesn't produce good fruit will be chopped down and thrown into the fire.

verses.kjv: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:
verses.web: I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.
verses.ct: I baptize you with water as a sign of repentance. But someone far more powerful than me is coming — I'm not even worthy to carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

verses.kjv: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
verses.web: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”
verses.ct: He holds a winnowing fork in his hand, and he will thoroughly clean his threshing floor. He'll gather the wheat into his barn, but the chaff he'll burn with fire that never goes out."

verses.kjv: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.
verses.web: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.
verses.ct: Then Jesus traveled from Galilee to the Jordan River to be baptized by John.

verses.kjv: But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
verses.web: But John would have hindered him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?”
verses.ct: John tried to stop him. "I'm the one who needs to be baptized by you," he said. "Why are you coming to me?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it to be so now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffered him.
verses.web: But Jesus, answering, said to him, “Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed him.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "Let it happen this way for now. This is how we should fulfill all righteousness." So John agreed.

verses.kjv: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:
verses.web: Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him.
verses.ct: As soon as Jesus came up out of the water, the heavens opened, and he saw the Spirit of God coming down like a dove and resting on him.

verses.kjv: And lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.web: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”
verses.ct: Then a voice spoke from heaven: "This is my beloved Son, and I am deeply pleased with him."
